panels.description: This report contains 2  gauges displaying the average planned and unplanned uptime of a selected VM for a requested period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR46 - This query returns for the specific vm
-- the total Unplanned_Downtime, Planned_Downtime, Uptime and total time in minutes.

SELECT
    SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) /
    SUM (
        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
    ) AS "Planned Downtime",
    SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status = 3
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) /
    SUM (
        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
    ) AS "Unplanned Downtime"
FROM
    (
     SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
     UNION
     SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
    ) AS hourly_daily
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    hourly_daily.vm_id in($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()

panels.title: Virtual Machine Uptime (BR46)

panels.description: This report contains a table displaying the average uptime of the selected VMs for a requested period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR46 - This query returns for the specific vm
-- the total Unplanned_Downtime, Planned_Downtime, Uptime and total time in minutes.

SELECT
    vm_name,
    SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) /
    SUM (
        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
    ) AS "planned_downtime",
    SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status = 3
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) /
    SUM (
        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
    ) AS "unplanned_downtime",
        SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) AS "planned_downtime_in_time",
    SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status = 3
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) AS "unplanned_downtime_in_time",
--    SUM (
--        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status
--    ) AS "total_time",
     SUM (
        CASE
            WHEN vm_status = 1
                THEN
                    COALESCE (
                        hourly_daily.minutes_in_status,
                        0
                    )
            ELSE 0
        END
    ) AS uptime_in_min,
    create_date,
    update_date
FROM
    (
     SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
     UNION
     SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
    ) AS hourly_daily
    INNER JOIN
        v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON (v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id=
            hourly_daily.vm_id)
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    hourly_daily.vm_id in($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
GROUP BY vm_name, create_date, update_date
ORDER BY vm_name

panels.title: Virtual Machines Uptime (BR46)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT vm_name AS __text, vm_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms WHERE cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
list.label: Virtual Machine
list.name: vm_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT vm_name AS __text, vm_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms WHERE cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
